intro: Bunchosia canescens, commonly known as the whitebrush or silverbrush, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in coastal areas. Bunchosia canescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to stabilize soil in sandy or coastal soils.
